alert.note: Alert for Juniata; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 9:08AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN JUNIATA AND NORTHEASTERN PERRY COUNTIES THROUGH 945 AM EDT... At 907 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles east of Lewistown, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newport, Richfield, Mexico, Ickesburg, Liverpool, Thompsontown, Millerstown and East Salem. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
